meanings.sent1: The overbig cake barely fit in the oven.
meanings.sent2: The overbig suitcase was too heavy to carry.
meanings.sent3: The overbig hat made him look like a walking mushroom.
meanings.sent4: Her overbig smile lit up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The overbig elephant blocked the entire road.

meanings.definition: To be larger than necessary or appropriate.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overbig her portions when serving dinner.
meanings.sent2: The company may overbig its budget if not careful.
meanings.sent3: He didn't mean to overbig the story, but it got exaggerated.
meanings.sent4: The tree seemed to overbig the entire garden with its branches.
meanings.sent5: The storm threatened to overbig the small town with flooding.
